docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 14. -- The last barrier to unanimous action between the United States and Latin-American republics in holding a conference suggested by President Roosevelt to solidify peace efforts in the Western Hemisphere was cleared away this...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 14. -- The last barrier to unanimous action between the United States and Latin-American republics in holding a conference suggested by President Roosevelt to solidify peace efforts in the Western Hemisphere was cleared away this evening by the extension of formal recognition by the United States and five other powers to the new government of Paraguay.

headline.main: PARAGUAY REGIME RECOGNIZED BY U.S.; Action Paves Way for Peace Conference Proposed by President Roosevelt.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 14. -- The government and the people united this afternoon in extending a triumphant welcome to Argentina's first Cardinal. Santiago Luis, Cardinal Copello, Primate of Argentina, Archbishop of Buenos Aires, received from the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 14. -- The government and the people united this afternoon in extending a triumphant welcome to Argentina's first Cardinal. Santiago Luis, Cardinal Copello, Primate of Argentina, Archbishop of Buenos Aires, received from the government all the official pomp and military honors usually reserved for visiting heads of States.
docs.abstract: With Cabinet, Sup Ct, prominent Congressmen and others, welcomes Card Copello to Argentina

headline.main: ARGENTINA GREETS ITS FIRST CARDINAL; Triumphant Welcome Extended to Prelate Who Started Life as Poor Farm Boy.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Barring the upward revision in the foreign currencies on Saturday which coincided with the possibility of a compromise of the political situation abroad following Germany's garrisoning of the Rhineland, the trend earlier in the week was decidedly...
docs.lead_paragraph: Barring the upward revision in the foreign currencies on Saturday which coincided with the possibility of a compromise of the political situation abroad following Germany's garrisoning of the Rhineland, the trend earlier in the week was decidedly downward. New minimum levels for the current movement were established, and in the case of the French franc that bill declined to the lowest since Jan. 23.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MARCH 14, 1936.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 19. -- An increase of more than $5,000,000 in the value of United States exports to Canada over the total for the preceding month was a feature of the Federal foreign trade statistics for January, according to revised figures made...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 19. -- An increase of more than $5,000,000 in the value of United States exports to Canada over the total for the preceding month was a feature of the Federal foreign trade statistics for January, according to revised figures made public today by the Department of Commerce.

headline.main: U.S.-CANADA TRADE LIFTED BY TREATY; Our Exports to the Dominion Rose $5,000,000 in January Over December. OTHER MARKETS DECLINED Aggregate Exports $197,958,000, Against $223,515,105 -- Import Total Slightly Higher.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 20. -- The time by which foreign governments and political subdivisions and foreign private corporate issuers must make application for permanent registration of their securities on American Exchanges, if trading in them is to be...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 20. -- The time by which foreign governments and political subdivisions and foreign private corporate issuers must make application for permanent registration of their securities on American Exchanges, if trading in them is to be continued, was extended until May 15 today by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

headline.main: SEC EXTENDS TIME ON FOREIGN BONDS; Deadline on Applications for Permanent Registration Now Set for May 15. 27 GOVERNMENTS FILED Several Issuers Are Reported Preparing Statements -- 7 Countries Missing.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange values last week were depressed to the lowest level in the last two months, an aftermath of the political crisis abroad. The proposed four-power plan to take a strong stand against Germany's occupation of the Rhineland was the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchange values last week were depressed to the lowest level in the last two months, an aftermath of the political crisis abroad. The proposed four-power plan to take a strong stand against Germany's occupation of the Rhineland was the underlying reason.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MARCH 21, 1936.
